'''''Aiglos 20''''' is a jubilee Polish language issue of '''''[[Aiglos (journal)|Aiglos]]'''''.,<ref>''Aiglos''' 20 official page in Polish http://aiglos.tolkien.com.pl/numer20.php (accessed 4 September 2016)</ref><ref>''Aiglos''' 20 official page in English http://aiglos.tolkien.com.pl/english/issue20.php (accessed 4 September 2016)</ref> which contains 326 pages filled with articles and artwork of artists from around the world. The highlight of the jubilee gallery is a page from the ''[[Parma Eldaliéva]]'' - a calligraphic art book in tengwar by 'Elmenel'. The first print run contains also a present in a form of decorative metal bookmark with ''Aiglos'' logo.
{{AiglosNav|19|21}}
==Contents==
{{AiglosTransl}}
* '''Cover Art'''
** ''Battle of Five Armies: Elves of Mirkwood''
*** By: Joona Kujanen

* '''Articles and essays'''
** "Tolkien’s philosophy and theology of death"
*** By: Christopher Garbowski
** "Reinterpretation of the heroic ideal in Tolkien’s writings on the basis of selected fragments of ''The Lord of the Rings''"
*** By: [[Łukasz Neubauer]]
** "All things considered, they shouldn’t be called by name. Proper names’ magic in Arda"
*** By: Zofia Żółtek 'Lassemista'
** "The Necromancer’s necromancy. Black magic, possession and zombie"
*** By: [[Jakub Tymiński|Jakub Tymiński 'Ominous']]
** "Éomer’s classical sources? Éomund’s son vs. young hero figure in antiquity"
*** By: Łukasz Szeląg 'leszli'

* '''Fanfiction and poetry''' 
** ''Gaffer Gamgee’s Bedtime Story'''
*** By: Zosia Stanecka 'Nasturcja Gamgee' 
** ''The last queen'' 
*** By: Tekla Cichocka 'Tici'

* '''Reviews and interviews'''
** An interview with [[Thomas Honegger]]
*** conducted and translated by [[Łukasz Neubauer]] 
** A collective review of ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]'' by the editorial staff
*** By:  [[Michał Leśniewski|Michał Leśniewski 'M.L']]
*** By:  Tadeusz Andrzej Olszański 'Halbarad Dúnadan'
*** By:  Jakub Tymiński 'Ominous'
*** By:  Magdalena Ułas 'Solaya'
*** By:  [[Karolina Stopa-Olszańska|Karolina Stopa-Olszańska 'Melinir']]
*** By:  [[Agnieszka Sylwanowicz|Agnieszka Sylwanowicz 'Evermind HS Took']]
*** By:  Małgorzata Dzikowska 'Marille Undómiel'
*** By:  [[User:Sirielle|Karolina Węgrzyn 'Sirielle']]
** [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] ''[[Beowulf]]''  
*** By: Arletta Chwojnicka 'Eilíf' 
** "Beasts, plants, creatures, and miraculous occurrences” - review of ''[[A Tolkien Bestiary]]'' by [[David Day]]
*** Karolina Stopa - Olszańska 'Melinir'  
** “Bilbo, or rather his ‘biographer’, astray” - review of ''[[Bilbo's Journey: Discovering the Hidden Meaning in The Hobbit]]'' by [[Joseph Pearce]]
*** By: Tadeusz Andrzej Olszański ‘Halbarad Dúnadan’
** “A new trend in blockbusters?” - review of the extended DVD edition of ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug]]''
*** By: Agnieszka Sylwanowicz 'Evermind HS Took'
** Report from Medieval Fantasy Symposium 2014 in Unieście, Poland
*** By: [[Łukasz Neubauer]]
** "Would J.R.R. Tolkien attend Tolk-Folk?" - report from XVI Tolk-Folk in Bielawa, Poland
*** By: Arletta Chwojnicka 'Eilíf'
** Reports from [[Oxonmoot 2014]] in Oxford, UK
*** By: Karolina Węgrzyn 'Sirielle'
*** By: Ewa Żygadło 'Hithlome'

* '''Polemics'''
** "What to make of this Hobbit?" a polemic against Maria Błaszkiewicz’s article
*** By: Tadeusz Andrzej Olszański ‘Halbarad Dúnadan’
** "What to make of this Hobbit?" answer to Tadeusz Andrzej Olszański’s polemic
*** By: Maria Błaszkiewicz
** "A few more words on Gil-galad’s paternity" – a polemic  against Barbara Cecylia Liwo’s article "Gil-galad – a paternity case"
*** By: Michał Leśniewski 'M.L.'

The issue contains also a hobbit genealogical crossword puzzle by Karolina Stopa-Olszanska 'Melinir' and Tolkien news from Poland and abroad.
